title: Women Hiding Menopause Symptoms and Why It's Hard
summary: This article talks about how many women feel they need to hide their menopause symptoms, like brain fog or pain, because they are embarrassed or think others will judge them. The author shared her own story about having trouble remembering things on TV due to perimenopause, and many people thanked her for talking about it. Famous people like Oprah Winfrey have also spoken out to make menopause less secret. Hiding symptoms can make women very tired and stressed, and it might lead to burnout. The article says that menopause affects half the population, so it's important to talk about it openly. Some changes are happening, like new health checks and workplace plans, but many women still don't know enough about menopause and feel they can't discuss it.

background_read: Menopause is a normal part of life for women, usually happening in their 40s or 50s, when their bodies change and they stop having periods. It can cause symptoms like hot flashes, mood swings, and trouble remembering things. Many women feel shy or worried about talking about it because they think people might laugh or not understand. This article explains why it's important to speak up and share experiences, so everyone can learn and support each other.

WHY: To show that talking openly about menopause can reduce shame and help women feel better.
